𒅄 𒋲·𒆳 𒇹²·𒍝²·𒆳 ĝeštae Gestirn 𒄑 cis "cyprus" ≈ 𒆜

𓌕 aster 𓊃𓈙𓂋𓌕 ˢtîr 𒋾 𓄝 Strahl australis 𓇾 𓐮 𓏏 𓇿 𓈉 ⇔ Ta-Seti shooting stars

𒀭𒊹 ≈ 𒐀𒁹𒎗 Aššur 𒀸𒋩 Ashur

Stars and planets = cows and sheep
In the religious text Nanna-Suen Hymn 1 (Sumerian period, 3rd-millennium BCE), cows are an allusion to the stars in the night sky.

стъалы st’aly

𓋴 𓃀 𓇼 𓏤 | star | •CCB 𐩫𐩥𐩫𐩨 kwkb ኮከብ kokäb old "cis" reading

𓋴 𓃀 𓄿 𓇼 𓇳 sbtara star

𓄿 𓐍 𓄿 | stars | acra ⋍ astra

𓇼 australis : south
𓇼 •vestra : west
𓇼 •vostra : east
𓇼 nostra?

𒀭𒅗𒁲𒈾𒋫 Ištaran

• Arabic ءَثْتَرْ (ʿaṯtar) : Hebrew עַשְׁתֹּרֶת (‘aštōreṯ) [Goddess Innana, Venus] with Sanskrit स्तृ (str̥) : Avestan 𐬀𐬯𐬙𐬀𐬭 (astar) [Star] (compare : Armenian աստղ առաւաւտին (astł aṙawawtin) [star-morning ; Venus])

𒀯𒀭 mul-an mulan heavenly star

𐘥 #KE цӏцӏа ccʼa ⲥⲓⲟⲩ 𒀯 kakkabu 𐎋𐎁𐎋𐎁 כוכבא kōḵəḇā ኮከብ kokäb ကြယ် krai khao 星 chheⁿ ふし husi
